definition: to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: Off-stage, let us hope life in Korea does not imitate art too closely.
sentences.chinese: 舞台下让我们希望朝鲜的王室不会上演剧里的情节。

sentences.english: YanJuDui accept people university invited, patriotic drama to show.
sentences.chinese: 演剧队接受立人大学邀请，前去演出爱国话剧。

sentences.english: Chapter Two: Performances of NMDS during the anti-Japanese war.
sentences.chinese: 第二章，详细介绍了国立剧校抗战时的演剧活动。

sentences.english: The son of a successful actor of the old school, he knew the theatre from early childhood on.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个老派成名演员的儿子，从小熟悉演剧。

sentences.english: The play should not be lost by his absence .
sentences.chinese: 不能由于他不在这里就不再演剧。

sentences.english: Contemporary Characters and the Reconfiguration of Acting in A Play of Jiangxi Tea - pickers'Opera.
sentences.chinese: 江西采茶戏的当代品格与演剧重构。

sentences.english: Chapter Three analyzes the performance characteristics of Fudan Dramatic Association.
sentences.chinese: 第三章分析复旦剧社的演剧倾向。

definition: to perform (e.g. on the stage)/to lecture

Spring Willow Society, pioneering Chinese theatrical company set up in Tokyo in 1906, part of New Culture Movement 新文化運動|新文化运动[Xin1 Wen2 hua4 Yun4 dong4], continued in China from 1912 as 新劇同志會|新剧同志会[Xin1 ju4 Tong2 zhi4 hui4]
to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)
